review: The Roku stick was purchased with the intentions of streaming the CBS All Access App that only appears to be available with Roku or Google Chromecast. I also have a Smart TV and an Amazon Fire Stick so I am already familiar with streaming devices. The Roku stick does appear to have all the major streaming apps that one would want, i. e. Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, YouTube, etc. The set up was pretty easy, have only had a problem a couple times losing the WiFi signal but was quick to be able to reconnect it. The major problem that I have experienced with it that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is that fact that it seems to get stuck sometimes and I'm not sure if it is a problem with the stick itself or the remote. When you push buttons on the remote there is no indication that the command has been accepted, no sound, no vibration, no visible lights. That is not necessarily a problem, but when I push buttons on the remote sometimes, especially if the TV has just been turned on to use the Roku stick I have had a actually take the batteries out and re-insert them in the remote to get the remote to "wake up" and start to function.

review: At this point, I wouldn't recommend the Roku Streaming stick to anyone. It has been difficult, to say the least to get this thing to work properly. Right now, it froze up and I can't get it to unfreeze. It has been frustrating. I didn't read any reviews with this problem. It seemed to work terribly with Hulu, when it was working, and alright with Prime. I hate it!

review: We have one of these on each of our TVs and use one for travel.  Overall, I've been pleased. We happened to have an extra remote so I didn't follow up with replacing it.
